arm_group.description: Adolescent Asthma Action in Jordan (TAJ) Plus the added class smoke free pledge will be implemented in high schools in Jordan and will be compared to the TAJ alone for its efficacy in decreasing smoking rates, lowering CO1 levela and nicotine dependence.
TAJ Plus the class smoke free pledge will be implemented in high schools in Jordan and compared to TAJ alone

brief_summary.textblock:
Study Hypotheses:

        1. adolescents in intervention schools who are given Triple A program plus ASP will show
           more awareness in regards to cigarettee smoking health effects and less nicotine
           dependencethan those in the control schools who are given Triple A alone.

        2. adolescents with asthma in intervention schools who are given Triple A program plus ASP
           will show less asthma symptoms and better control than those in the control schools who
           are given Triple A alone.

        3. adolescent smokers and passive smokers will exhibit higher levels of carbon monoxide
           (CO) in their breath than those who are not active or passive smokers.

        4. there is a positive correlation between self-report questions regarding student smoking
           status and levels of CO in their breath

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of School-Based, Peer-Led Asthma and Smoking Prevention Program on CO1 Levels and Smoking Behavior Among Early Adolescents in Jordan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: students in grades 7 and 8 in Irbid city high schools, can speak and
        read in both Arabic and English, obtain parental agreement, attend regular school.

        -

        Exclusion Criteria:students with other chronic diseases (rather than asthma),

        -

intervention.description: Its is a school-based peer-led asthma and smoking prevention program that aims at improving asthma control and lowering nicotine dependence among smokers.
intervention.intervention_name: TAJ Plus (Adolescent Asthma Action in Jordan) Plus the added class smoke free pledge

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of School-Based, Peer-Led Asthma and Smoking Prevention Program on CO1 Levels, Nicotine Dependence, and Smoking Behavior Among Early Adolescents in Jordan

primary_outcome.description: Self-administered nicotine dependence scale will be used in order to measure nicotine dependence level for adolescent smokers and passive smokers
The pictorial version of the asthma control test will be measured for adolescents with asthma and recent wheezing

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Jordan University of Science and Technology

secondary_outcome.description: CO levels will be tested in adolescents' breath

secondary_outcome.measure: knowledge about health effects of cigarettee smoking

collaborator.agency: Jordan University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Prevention
